extendedInfo.description: The only 100% FREE Gamepad keyboard for playing games. Emulates a simple D-Dpad directional keys / Cursor Keyboard Keys, and four separate buttons.Emulate a Game Controller on your phone.  Designed for use with DosBox Turbo, but works with other Android emulators, OnLive, SplashTop and any Android game/app that can use a Keyboard (utilizes the standard Android Input Method Framework). Features:=========â True 8-Way or emulated 8-Way Directional Padâ Custom Mappable 8-way DPadâ DosBox Turbo / Xbox360 mode Controller emulationâ ESC and Function Keys (F1-F12)â Re-Map A,B,X,Y buttons to Different Keysâ Multi-Touch capable (depends on phone hardware)â Built in Transparent Keyboardâ Uses standard Android Input Method (IME)â Configurable Transparency Levelsâ Swipe Left/Right to switch from Keyboard to GamePadâ Swipe Down for Settingsâ Configurable Swipe GesturesTo Use:=======After installation, Enable "Game Pad" in the Android Settings->Keyboards section.Choose "Game Pad" as the Input Method.** NOTE:  The game/app must SUPPORT using Standard Android Input Method (ie. Keyboard) as an input method.  If the game does not allow input from a virtual keyboard, then there is nothing Gamepad can do.

reviews.title: Needs more Button Support....
reviews.comment: This doesn\'t work for a majority of the games I wanna play with it in DosBox because it\'s limited to only a D-pad and 4 buttons. :-/. It\'d be nice if it could have a 10 button layout. :(. Otherwise, it is pretty solid and works great.
reviews.author: Daniel McMann

reviews.title: Very good, could be better
reviews.comment: This gamepad has been great for my old DOS adventure games. What could make it even better would be a broader selection of key assignments for the D-pad. Especially numpad keys/home-end-pgup-pgdn for the diagonals.
reviews.author: Andrew Molnar

reviews.title: Dissapointing.
reviews.comment: Quite annoying.  Only 4 buttons, with no option to add or remove them, and for whatever reason, you cant assign cursor key or numpad inputs to it, a pretty big oversight in something designed for dos games.  Also, the swipe-to-switch function hardly ever works, and there is no way to map a hardware button to call it up.  In short, useless to me.
reviews.author: Eric Yost

reviews.title: 0 stars
reviews.comment: This sucks.  The stupid application won\'t even download.  Make sure your cheap crap works b4 u put it on the market.
